attributes.action: MP’s to vote according to the referendum results: voted by their constituents
attributes.additional_details: The majority of areas opted to leave the EU resulting in Brexit. MP’s should do the job they were elected to do: to represent the voices if the people who elected them and not vote against their constituents voice as expressed in the 2016 Referendum.
attributes.background: Despite the people taking the time to vote in the referendum, their voices are not being represented at parliament. Leave the EU was the democratic referendum result. Elected MP’s should represent their constituents results regardless

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
